programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Movie
programme.desc: Young Yugi (Dan Green) must use his game skills to defeat his bitter rival (Eric Stuart) and an Egyptian mummy.

programme.title: God Mars: The Movie
programme.desc: A young man struggles to understand his place in the universe after suffering several family tragedies and living in isolation.

programme.title: Kite Liberator
programme.desc: Monaka seems to be just an average high school girl, but she has a dark and terrible secret linking her past to a murderous police detective and her future to a fatal duel with the one person she loves most in the world.

programme.title: Night on the Galactic Railroad
programme.desc: On the night of a festival, young Giovanni and his friend Campanella embark on a train that takes them across the Milky Way. Together, they meet peculiar passengers as they travel toward an unknown destination.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Datto!!: The Blood Soaked School Sports Festival
programme.desc: The gang helps Keiichiro train for a sports festival at school; a mysterious boy shows up at the track, running alongside Keiichiro; despite the bonding between the two, it seems the new boy isn't quite alive.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Night of Tragedy: The Demon Hand That Tears Through Doors
programme.desc: Stories spread about something preying on children who are alone, and the gang gets scared; especially since their parents will be out for the night; a deadly ghost with a sickle in hand stalks Satsuki and her friends.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Utsushimi: The Soul Stolen by the Mirror!
programme.desc: People all over town begin acting strangely; most of them have been replaced by mirror-world clones of themselves; with Satsuki and Hajime being the last two people in the town who haven't been swapped, they'll have to find a way to end this ghost.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: The Ogre of the Underworld: The Circuits That Lead to Hell
programme.desc: Leo is convinced that there's a ghostly website out there on the internet and is determined to find it, which he does; trapped in the computer, the rest of the gang needs to figure out how to apply old-fashioned exorcism to new technologies.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Ikki and Metabee showcase their talents to an arrogant Victor.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Ikki and Koji each want to be team leader.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: When Metabee's medal goes missing, the gang suspects that Team France has stolen it.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Samantha unravels as she prepares for a ballet recital while training for her next match.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic loses his memory when Dr. Robotnik uses a hypnotic flower pollen on him and tells him he's just an ordinary guy; with Tails trying to remind him who he is, Sonic joins a Hog Biker gang and hits the open road.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Scratch and Grounder build their own robot, a naive, overgrown kid called Robot, who leaves them and befriends Sonic instead.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: When Sonic vanishes mysteriously, Tails enlists the help of a bi-plane pilot named William Le' Duc and professor Von Schlemmer.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Wes Weasley sells out to Robotnik and lures Tails, Sonic and all of their friends to a yacht under the guise of a Hero of the Year ceremony to thank Sonic.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Lazy con-man Bo Beagle has the Choas Emerald ring stuck on his finger, and Robotnik wants it for one of his evil schemes,so he can use the emerald to sink the continent of LABYRINTH into the sea.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.sub-title: Lifestyles of the Sick and Twisted
programme.desc: Throbbin Screech brings a TV crew to interview Robotnik for his talk show "Lifestyles of the Sick and Twisted"; Robotnik rampages through the Mobius countryside to prove he belongs on the program, keeping Sonic busy with rescues.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Momma Robotnik forces her son to run for president of Mobius, with Wes Weasley as his campaign manager; when Sonic hears of this, he runs, too -- and bedevils Robotnik every step of the high-speed campaign.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik captures a flute-playing ninja crane called Kwai Chang Crane and taps his martial arts knowledge with electrodes attached to his head, then transfers it to Scratch and Grounder.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik invents a ray gun that transports Sonic, Tails, and Robotnik's gang into a storybook.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.sub-title: Super Special Sonic Search & Smash Squad
programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik has created two new Badniks whose full job is to eradicate Sonic; Coconuts, Dr. R's Monkey robot, tries to capture Sonic before the other Badniks.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic and Tails head into a network of abandoned mine shafts to escape Scratch and Grounder.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic saves a hedgehog girl, Breezie, from Scratch and Grounder, and falls for her; Breezie is truly a robot created by Robotnik to exterminate Sonic.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan and Jimsy must catch a wild pig in order to redeem themselves with Orlo, the leader of a local gang.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Lana has a nightmarish vision that Dr. Lao's flying machine is engulfed in flames and fears an attack; Conan does his best to try and ease her worries.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: When Industria soldiers reach High Harbor, the villagers must band together to defend their home.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan and Lana try to evade Industria's soldiers but Lana is captured.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: As the fight for High Harbor continues, Lana fears the arrival of another earthquake.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: In the wake of the tsunami, the villagers allow the Industria soldiers to join their community.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.sub-title: Uncover the Secret of Tsukikage Castke
programme.desc: Massive riches have been hidden inside Tsukikage Castle; Lupin and his gang must decipher a code to find out the whereabouts of the great treasure.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.sub-title: The Hidden Gold of Genghis Khan
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen head to Mongolia in search of Genghis Khan's treasures; Goemon is visiting his ancestors' grave to pay his respects when he encounters Fujiko.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.desc: The ICPO chief promises to erase Fujiko's criminal record in exchange for her cooperation in arresting Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.sub-title: Diamonds Disappeared Under the Hong Kong Sky
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen sneak on board a ship smuggling diamonds; however, what they find on board are several thousand chickens.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.sub-title: Get fired up in the cold winter wind
programme.desc: Hiromi can't get along with Madam Butterfly, and their pairing isn't working out; increasingly worried, Hiromi's playing only worsens; as if to reject her further, Madam Butterfly takes a day off from practice.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.sub-title: The secret to a doubles pair
programme.desc: With their eyes set on the Kanto Tournament, Hiromi and Reika are training hard; however, Hiromi's misplays are rampant; but the invincible doubles pair of Todo and Ozaki are there to watch over her.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: The first round of the Kanto Junior Doubles Championship series has begun; Reika and Hiromi face a tough opponent, Showa High; Reika continues to ignore her partner and play by herself.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.sub-title: The secret to a doubles pair
programme.desc: With their eyes set on the Kanto Tournament, Hiromi and Reika are training hard; however, Hiromi's misplays are rampant; but the invincible doubles pair of Todo and Ozaki are there to watch over her.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: Just running fast won't get you far in tennis; that's Coach Munakata's advice to a proud Hiromi as she runs around; but besides training more, there's nothing else she can do for now.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Aoki, Takemura and Ippo visit Kimura because he has a high fever; Aoki's and Kimura's life as delinquents is shown.
